metadata.title: CVE-2019-7638 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
SDL (Simple DirectMedia Layer) through 1.2.15 and 2.x through 2.0.9 has aheap-based buffer over-read in Map1toN in video/SDL_pixels.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7638` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl2-2.0-0 - 2.0.2+dfsg1-3ubuntu1.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libsdl1.2debian - 1.2.15-8ubuntu1.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libsdl2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.2+dfsg1-3ubuntu1.3').
libsdl1.2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.15-8ubuntu1.1+esm1').
